intro: Ochrocarpos angustifolius, commonly known as the narrow-leaved ochrocarpus, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its narrow, linear leaves are arranged oppositely along the stems, and it produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in spring. The species is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological adaptations.
